title: Classic Pistilli Roman style font
content:
Help me id these two fonts. I know they are similar to Pistilli Roman and Didoni.

Are there similar fonts to these that you may know of?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [arunb.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085200/http:/typophile.com/files/arunb.gif) | 859 bytes |
| [vera.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085200/http:/typophile.com/files/vera.gif) | 98.99 KB |

 [‹ Kentucky State Police logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085200/http:/typophile.com/node/48578 "Go to previous forum topic") [MTV Australia screen font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085200/http:/typophile.com/node/48570 "Go to next forum topic")
author: marcuss

comments.content:
The Vera Wang lettering is probably a custom Bodoni-inspired look. I think we’ve discussed it before.

The other sample is fairly small, but looks more Century-ish than Didoni, to me.

- Mike Yanega

arunb - also close to [Sackers Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085200/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/sackers_roman_std_heavy/?sample_text=arunb) and [Luxury Diamond](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085200/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=536&subpage=viewfontspecimens).

vera is likely custom, but closest to [Didot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085200/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/linotype_didot_std_roman/?sample_text=VERA%20WANG&sample_size=60)
thanks for the quick id, guys!
